attributes.title: Stock Take
attributes.description: Physical stock count compared to the book balances
attributes.recommendation: The controls in place to safeguard stocks items is recommendable and should be maintained
attributes.effect: Minimal stock variances is an indication of good controls in place

value: We shall continue to ensure all stock items are well accounted for
As a team, we shall maintain the stocks controls in place.
In the prior audit on 21st Dec 2024, it was noted that there were zero or minimal variations.
Current
Physical stock counted on 22nd Feb 2025, Bread had a +29.75 loaves, Utto had -0.254 Litres, white flour had -4.045 kgs, and poly bags had -180 pcs. The rest of the stock items had minimal variances
Minimal stock variances is an indication of good controls in place.
Operations/Production Department
To ensure there are no loss as a result of stock variances.

attributes.title: Bread Weight
attributes.description: From the samples of packed bread weighed, bread underweight were noted as follows; 400g CT - 3%, 400g Grande – 13%, 400g SN – 17
attributes.recommendation: The branch management should ensure that the set weight standards are adhered to in order to eliminate cases of underweight bread.
attributes.effect: Underweight bread dispatched to the market can lead to fines and penalties if caught by weight and measure agency.

value: We shall continue to emphasis on right bread production set standards to ensure final product is of the correct weight and also weigh bread before packing.
The branch manager is advised to be conducting random weight check to ensure there is compliance.
In the prior audit, from the sample selected numerous underweight were noted across all the varieties sampled and weighed expect on 400 Grande
Current

Bread weight was taken from a sample selected from packed bread ready to be dispatched to the market. The aim was to determine whether the bread dispatched to the market meets the required weight standards.
Presence of underweight bread is an indication that the company is exposed to financial and reputational risks
Operations/Production Department
To confirm that bread dispatched to the market meets the recommended weight standard.

attributes.title: Bread Damages
attributes.description: It was found that production damages were averaging at 0.22% of the production and market damages stood at 0.46% of the total sales.
attributes.recommendation: The branch team need to employ adequate measures to reduce damages related to production.
attributes.effect: Excess production damages recorded for the period exceeded the set threshold exposing the company to a revenue loss of Kshs. 2,193.04.  Market damages were well controlled and within the recorded level.

value: We have seen a reduction in bread damages and we will continue to ensure we take correct measures to minimize on production damages.
I recommend the branch team on damages control and urge them to continue managing bread damages.
In the prior audit on 21 Dec 2024, it was noted that the overall production damages were 0.22% of bread produced while market damages were 0.37% of the sales for the same period.
Current

Analysis of production and market damages was done for the period of 49 days from 15 Jan 2025 to 21 Feb 2025 to determine whether bread damages were within the set threshold of 0.20% to total production and 0.50% of the total sales.

Excess production damages recorded for the period exceeded the set threshold exposing the company to a revenue loss of Kshs. 2,193.04.  Market damages were well controlled and within the recorded level.
Operations/Production Department
To ensure bread damages are controlled to minimize revenue loss.

attributes.title: Mixing charts analysis
attributes.description: From the analysis, it was noted that the branch average production per day was 20 bags which is 37% of the branch target of 54 bags, Average yield was 189.16 and there were no cases of remixes during the period.
attributes.recommendation: The sales team need to explore more opportunities in terms market expansion and probably establish new market routes to take advantage of the existing branch production capacity.
attributes.effect: 37% production target achieved implies that there was an idle production capacity of 63%.

value: Plans are underway by the sales team to have the Nanyuki route transferred from Karatina to Nyeri. This will boost branch sales and increase production.
Low sales affecting the branch production. We only produce as per the orders.

In the prior audit, Average yield per bag was 189.35 loaves per bag, Utto consumption was at 100%, Average production was 26.89 bags per day representing 49.80% of target achievement which is 54 bags per day, Bread posted on SAP systems matched with bread recorded on manual mixing chart summaries totaling 239358 loaves from 1st November 2024 to 17th December 2024 and no remix was noted.
Current

An analysis of mixing chart summary was done for a period of 38 days from 15 Jan 2025 to 21 Feb 2025, to determine if the raw materials usage were as per the set BOM, yield achieved and the accuracy of physical mixing charts records transferred to cash flow and SAP.
Failure to meet the set targets implies that the branch production capacity was not fully utilized. 37% target achievement in production implies that there was an idle production capacity of 63%.
Operations/Production Department
To confirm accuracy of data in the mixing charts transferred to cash flow and SAP, BOM of raw materials usage, production level and yield achieved.

attributes.title: Cash count
attributes.description: It was noted that expected cash had no material variance with the cash counted.
attributes.recommendation: The branch cashier should maintain the controls in place at the cash office
attributes.effect: Expected cash in the branch was properly accounted for which implies that the controls in place are adequate.

value: This is well noted.
The cash office spot check results are well noted

In the previous audit, it was found out the sum amount in cash that the cashier should have of Ksh 15,265.00 at the time of audit was certified to be the amount that the cashier had at that particular time.
Current
Verification of cash held at the cash office was done on 23rd February 2025, to confirm cash held by the cashier and whether the set cash operation standards are adhered to.
Cash is always a high risk thus it should be adequately controlled and monitored to ensure proper accountability.
Operations/Production Department
To ensure proper accountability of cash in the branch.

attributes.title: Mini shop spot check
attributes.description: Mini shop sales proceed were properly accounted as illustrated below;
attributes.recommendation: The branch management is encouraged to maintain good stock and cash controls at the mini shop.
attributes.effect: Operations at the mini shop were being carried out in accordance with the established standards with no material variances noted

value: We shall continue to ensure we observe the operation procedures as set out.
We will maintain the controls.
No previous finding
Current
A spot check was conducted in the mini shop on 22nd Feb 2025 to assess whether the operation were being carried out in accordance with the established standards
The operations at the mini shop were being carried out in accordance with the established standards.
Sales Department
To ensure all bread transferred to the mini shop are accounted for and that the bread is sold on cash basis

attributes.title: Debtors Analysis
attributes.description: It was noted that, the total outstanding debtors amounted to Kshs. 641,271.50. Most of the balances are for active institutions. Dormant accounts (highlighted) had an outstanding balance of Kshs. 5,328 and follow up by the sales Rep is ongoing.
attributes.recommendation:
The sales Rep to follow collection on the noted dormant account. 

Sales Rep should ensure credit payments terms with institutions are strictly adhered to.
attributes.effect: Route balances on dormant account can lead to bad debts and hence financial losses to the company

value: We shall ensure bread is only supplied to customer with no balances except for institutions and supermarkets with credit arrangements.
Sales Rep to follow on the dormant account
There was no previous finding
Current
An analysis of the route balances was done as at COB 21st Feb 2025 to ascertain the status thereof.
Route balances on dormant accounts can lead to bad debts and hence financial losses to the company
Sales Department
To ensure supplies are paid for on delivery where credit arrangements does not exist.

attributes.title: Production efficiency
attributes.description: It was noted that the production efficiency was 4.70 bags per production worker which is above the set efficiency
attributes.recommendation: The branch management should keep up with good control on production work force.
attributes.effect: Efficiency achieved for the period reviewed implies that production workers were well controlled and no extra cost were incurred in Production.

value: We shall maintain and ensure hired production workers achieve the set efficiency.
The efficiency is well controlled and we shall ensure that this maintained.
In the previous audit, it was noted that the production efficiency was 4.61 bags per production worker, which was above the set target
Current

Production efficiency was calculated for period of 38 days from 15th Jan 2025 to 21st Feb 2025. The aim was to determine if the production workers hired were achieving the set production efficiency of 4.3 bags per worker.
The production target efficiency of 4.3 bags per worker was achieved for the period reviewed which implies production workers were well controlled.
Operations/Production Department
To ensure that Production labour cost is well controlled.

attributes.title: Packing Efficiency
attributes.description: The analysis revealed that the average slicing efficiency for the period was 90.82 crates per slicer
attributes.recommendation: Branch management should manage slicers effectively to ensure they achieve the desired packing efficiency.
attributes.effect: Packing efficiency of 90.82 crates per slicer implies that the company incurred Kshs 8,208 on extra slicers hired during the period under review

value: We have improved on the efficiency and we shall continue to push to attain the set target.
We will push to attain the acceptable efficiency.
In the prior audit done on 21st Dec 2024, it was noted that average packing efficiency for the sample period was 70.08 crates per slicer.
Current
Packing efficiency was computed for 38 days from 15th January 2025 to 21st Feb 2025 to determine whether the set company standard of 97 crates per slicer was being achieved.

Packing efficiency of 90.82 crates per slicer implies that the company incurred Kshs 8,208 on extra slicers hired during the period under review. The branch management should ensure hired slicers achieve the set standard of 97 crates per slicer.
Operations/Production Department
To ensure hired slicers are managed efficiently to control labor cost.
